stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes the shift to modernism in late-nineteenth-century European cultural and intellectual life?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of progress and modernity in the nineteenth century.

choicesHtml: A renewed faith in traditional authorities together with a return to religiosity
A revived belief that science alone produces knowledge
A new relativism in values together with a loss of confidence in objective knowledge
A new belief that progress is inevitably achieved through rationality
